repositories.brief_summary: Six PRs merged including new let expression syntax, toplevel -init/-e fixes, and documentation improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: New syntax for arbitrary structure items in let expressions, toplevel -init now works with -e flag
repositories.new_features:
- **Arbitrary structure items** now allowed in `let` expressions, enabling `let module rec`, `let exception`, `let open`, `let type`, and `let class` syntax within expression contexts ([#14040](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14040))
- **Toplevel `-init` flag** now properly loads initialization files when combined with `-e` flag for script execution ([#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190))
- **Iarray documentation** expanded with examples for constructing immutable arrays from array literals, plus additions to core library documentation ([#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397))

repositories.new_features_summary: Performance improvement for `opam show` and AppArmor installation fix for /usr/bin

- **Fixed AppArmor support** in the install script when installing opam to `/usr/bin`, avoiding profile conflicts with the system's builtin opam profile ([#6823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6823) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), fixing [#6820](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6820))
- **API additions**: New `OpamGlobalState.all_installed_versions` function for retrieving all installed packages and their switches at once ([#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6818))
- **API additions**: New `OpamCompat.Map.add_to_list` utility function ([#6818](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6818))

- **AVX2 gather intrinsics** add support for vectorized memory gather operations with semi-new addressing mode `reg + vec[..] * scale + displ`, enabling efficient scattered memory access patterns ([#5040](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5040))
- **Profiling output control** via new `-dprofile-output <filename>` flag allows redirecting profiling data to specific files instead of stdout ([#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074))
- **Debug metrics file control** through `-ddwarf-metrics-output-file` flag enables custom output location for DWARF debug metrics ([#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074))
- **No-locs compiler flag** adds `-no-locs` option for suppressing location information in output, useful for deterministic test outputs ([#5072](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5072))
- **Domain.self_index portability** annotation correctly marks `Domain.self_index` as portable in stdlib signature ([#5101](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5101))
- **Improved artifact cleanup** provides finer control over compiler artifact generation and removal, fixing cases where `-stop-after` incorrectly deleted unrelated files ([#5085](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5085))

group_summaries.new_features:
- **Immutable arrays of unboxed products** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) enable creation of iarrays containing unboxed product types, expanding support for layout-polymorphic immutable collections ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5026](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5026))
- **Arrays of GC-ignorable values** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) introduce `Pgcignorableaddrarray` kind for arrays containing pointers that do not need GC scanning, improving memory efficiency ([oxcaml/oxcaml#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963))
- **AVX2 gather intrinsics** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) add support for vectorized memory gather operations with semi-new addressing mode `reg + vec[..] * scale + displ`, enabling efficient scattered memory access patterns ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5040](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5040))
- **Profiling output control** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) via new `-dprofile-output <filename>` flag allows redirecting profiling data to specific files instead of stdout ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074))
- **Debug metrics file control** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through `-ddwarf-metrics-output-file` flag enables custom output location for DWARF debug metrics ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074))
- **No-locs compiler flag** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) adds `-no-locs` option for suppressing location information in output, useful for deterministic test outputs ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5072](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5072))
- **Type hovers for jkind abbreviations** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) enable developers to see expanded forms when hovering over jkind annotations, including support for non-`value` kinds like `bit32` and `void`, forall annotations, and type annotations ([oxcaml/merlin#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200))
- **Expanded compiler flag support** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) adds ~30 previously unrecognized OCaml compiler flags to Merlin's ignored flags list, preventing errors when Merlin is invoked with the same flags as the compiler ([oxcaml/merlin#202](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/202))
- **Domain.self_index portability** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) annotation correctly marks `Domain.self_index` as portable in stdlib signature ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5101](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5101))
- **Improved artifact cleanup** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) provides finer control over compiler artifact generation and removal, fixing cases where `-stop-after` incorrectly deleted unrelated files ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5085](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5085))
- **Quote printing fixes** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) resolve bugs in printing character literals, string literals, quoted strings, and labelled function parameters under quotations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5079](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5079))
- **Slambda splices in Lambda** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) add support for embedding Slambda code within Lambda expressions for metaprogramming ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5023](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5023))
- **Ast_mapper quote support** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) fixes AST mapper to correctly handle quotes and splices in parse tree transformations ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5077](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5077))
- **GADT with-bounds re-enabled** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) restores support for with-bounds constraints on GADT type parameters after previous restrictions ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5046](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5046))
- **Loose staticity checking** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) relaxes overly strict mode checks for static values in certain contexts ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5075](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5075))
- **Mode error prioritization** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) ensures application type errors are reported before mode errors for better error message clarity ([oxcaml/oxcaml#5073](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5073))

- **Five new PRs opened** in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml) including Dune build improvements by [Ali Caglayan](https://github.com/Alizter) ([ocaml/ocaml#14408](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14408)), relaxed value restriction documentation by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([ocaml/ocaml#14407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14407)), and Unix socket address handling by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) ([ocaml/ocaml#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406))
- **Shell script portability improvements** merged with [ocaml/ocaml#14398](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14398) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm) using `/usr/bin/env bash` for broader BSD and Linux compatibility
- **Documentation corrections** merged including ocamlopt man page fix by [@oakrotka](https://github.com/oakrotka) ([ocaml/ocaml#14400](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14400)) and typo corrections across 21 files by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) ([ocaml/ocaml#14399](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14399))
- **Filename.quote POSIX compliance** work ongoing by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) to only quote shell arguments when necessary ([ocaml/ocaml#14378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14378)), with discussion on backward compatibility
- **Type system enhancements** progressing with removal of `let rec (module M)` by [Alistair](https://github.com/johnyob) ([ocaml/ocaml#14388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14388)) and inclusion check error message improvements by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([ocaml/ocaml#14205](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14205))
- **Relocatable OCaml implementation** marked merge-ready with [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) seeking reviews for `--with-relative-libdir` feature ([ocaml/ocaml#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244))
- **Platform-specific improvements** advancing including thread-safe POSIX functions by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) ([ocaml/ocaml#13700](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13700)), Android Termux support by [Samuel Bronson](https://github.com/SamB) ([ocaml/ocaml#14382](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14382)), and Haiku OS native backend by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) ([ocaml/ocaml#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- **Bytecode optimization hints** PR by [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) preserving lambda information for js_of_ocaml and wasm_of_ocaml ([ocaml/ocaml#13438](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13438))
- **RFC discussion** in [ocaml/RFCs](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs) on `val` declarations in structures by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59)), with [Nicolas Jeannerod](https://github.com/Niols) proposing alternative grammar using `and` separators
group_summaries.cross_repository_work:
- **Val declarations RFC** in [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59) by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) proposes new syntax that would require implementation changes in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), with [Nicolas Jeannerod](https://github.com/Niols) suggesting alternative grammar approaches
- **Language feature discussions** spanning both repositories include the merged arbitrary structure items in let expressions ([ocaml/ocaml#14040](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14040)) and the proposed val declarations RFC ([ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59)), both addressing structure-level syntax extensions
- **Documentation coordination** between [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)'s relaxed value restriction explanation ([ocaml/ocaml#14407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14407)) and RFC authoring demonstrates active engagement in both language design and implementation documentation
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **Unix socket address length calculation** identified as potentially incorrect by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) in [ocaml/ocaml#14401](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14401), showing Linux adds missing null terminator while Haiku does not, leading to PR [ocaml/ocaml#14406](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14406)
- **Hashtbl peek and pop functions** proposed by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette) for fast access to arbitrary elements without iteration overhead in [ocaml/ocaml#14402](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/discussions/14402)
- **Alternative grammar for val declarations** proposed by [Nicolas Jeannerod](https://github.com/Niols) in [ocaml/RFCs#59](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/pull/59) suggesting bundling multiple `val` declarations with `and` separators before `let` bindings
- **Single constructor unboxing feature** discussed by [Jean-Christophe Filliatre](https://github.com/backtracking) in [ocaml/ocaml#14403](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14403) with input from [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche)
- **Queue garbage collection issue** investigated by [@alastairpatrick](https://github.com/alastairpatrick) on Windows in [ocaml/ocaml#14396](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14396) with debugging assistance from multiple contributors

weekly_summary.new_features:
- __RUMINANT:tools__ **Dune 3.21.0-alpha0** released by [Shon Feder](https://github.com/shonfeder) delivering the first alpha of the 3.21 series with package management maturation and developer experience improvements [ocaml/dune#3.21.0_alpha0](https://github.com/ocaml/dune/releases/tag/3.21.0_alpha0)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Arbitrary structure items in let expressions** now supported in [ocaml/ocaml](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml), enabling `let module rec`, `let exception`, `let open`, `let type`, and `let class` syntax within expression contexts [ocaml/ocaml#14040](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14040)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Toplevel -init flag compatibility** with `-e` flag fixed, allowing initialization files to load properly during script execution [ocaml/ocaml#14190](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14190)
- __RUMINANT:core__ **Iarray documentation expansion** with examples for constructing immutable arrays from array literals and additions to core library documentation [ocaml/ocaml#14397](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14397)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Immutable arrays of unboxed products** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) enable creation of iarrays containing unboxed product types, expanding support for layout-polymorphic immutable collections [oxcaml/oxcaml#5026](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5026)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Arrays of GC-ignorable values** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) introduce `Pgcignorableaddrarray` kind for arrays containing pointers that do not need GC scanning, improving memory efficiency [oxcaml/oxcaml#4963](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4963)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **AVX2 gather intrinsics** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) add support for vectorized memory gather operations with semi-new addressing mode `reg + vec[..] * scale + displ`, enabling efficient scattered memory access patterns [oxcaml/oxcaml#5040](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5040)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Profiling output control** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) via new `-dprofile-output <filename>` flag allows redirecting profiling data to specific files instead of stdout [oxcaml/oxcaml#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Debug metrics file control** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) through `-ddwarf-metrics-output-file` flag enables custom output location for DWARF debug metrics [oxcaml/oxcaml#5074](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5074)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **No-locs compiler flag** in [oxcaml/oxcaml](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml) adds `-no-locs` option for suppressing location information in output, useful for deterministic test outputs [oxcaml/oxcaml#5072](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5072)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Type hovers for jkind abbreviations** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) enable developers to see expanded forms when hovering over jkind annotations, including support for non-`value` kinds like `bit32` and `void`, forall annotations, and type annotations [oxcaml/merlin#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200)
- __RUMINANT:oxcaml__ **Expanded compiler flag support** in [oxcaml/merlin](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin) adds ~30 previously unrecognized OCaml compiler flags to Merlin's ignored flags list, preventing errors when Merlin is invoked with the same flags as the compiler [oxcaml/merlin#202](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/202)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **rizzo 0.1.0** - randomness testing library by [@tjobi](https://github.com/tjobi) [ocaml/opam-repository#29013](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29013)
- __RUMINANT:ecosystem__ **alice 0.2.0** - library for creating turn-based games by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs) [ocaml/opam-repository#29009](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/issues/29009)
